Progressive Web Applications

What are the main characteristics of a PWA?

Progressive Web Applications, also known as "PWA's", are web applications that are reliable, fast, and engaging.

  • Reliable because they don't require a persistent internet connection to access preloaded content, thanks to service workers.
  • Fast since they load inestentaneously, and are responsive to user input.
  • Engaging because they are launched just like any other application on a user's device, can send push notifications, and can dictate advanced layout configuration such as device orientation.

Caching, push notifications, are local data storage fundemental technologies used to make PWA's.

A very fundemental aspect of PWA's is the "manifest file", which dictates information about the application such as available app icons, orientation, application name, and the application's starting page.
